content:
Hello there.
I have a question on profiling the trigger for a condition. Our use case is chronic wound management. Wounds can occur due to events which happen at a moment, like crashes, cuts, or surgical procedures, or due to events happening over a longer period, like wearing the worng footwear over a longer period of time. Now we have modeled the wound as a condition which needs to be treated. Now I am unsure how to model the trigger event. Does anyone have a good idea? Thanks in advance!
I'll add this to an upcoming PC FHIR conference call (probably Sept 3)
@Michelle (Moseman) Miller: Thanks. Is there a way I can attend the call?
There is call information at http://www.hl7.org/concalls/CallDetails.aspx?concall=49731 but is says the call is cancelled...
Thank you for the link! The cancelled call is for tomorrow. I'll keep it in my eye.

Today (Aug 27) is cancelled, but this will be on the agenda for Sept 3. You are welcome to attend:
http://www.hl7.org/concalls/CallDetails.aspx?concall=49732
https://zoom.us/j/5328571160

@Emma Jones mentioned the HL7 extension http://build.fhir.org/extension-condition-dueto.html that can be used to document what caused/triggered this Condition
@Jay Lyle shared https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-skin-wound-ig/branches/master/index.html, which has an extension for the cause of the wound https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-skin-wound-ig/branches/master/StructureDefinition-WoundTypeEtiologyExt.html.
In sum, this raises the question (TBD) whether WoundTypeEtiologyExt is redundant of condition-dueto. Jay will follow up with the project team
